home.title: Welcome to my portfolio
home.presentation1: I'm Genís, a computer systems technician and junior web developer. I enjoy computing in all its aspects, from programming to systems administration and hardware.
home.presentation2: On this page, you'll find a bit about my background, my skills, and some projects I've worked on. If you're looking for someone responsible, eager to learn, and grow professionally, you're in the right place.
home.descriptionYepes: Configuration and supervision of the palletizing machine, process control and pallet safety for transportation.
home.descriptionTorres: Website update, automation with Visual Basic in Excel, and network mapping.
home.titleCapa: IT Technician at Institut Caparrell - Internship Contract
home.descriptionCapa: Maintenance and repair of equipment, installation and configuration of operating systems, software management and backups.
home.titleOptica: IT Technician at Natural Optics Group - Internship Contract
home.descriptionOptica: Equipment maintenance, operating system installation and software setup ensuring proper device operation.
home.descriptionAlpicat: Web application developed with PHP and the CodeIgniter 4 framework, with a MySQL database. The project allows users of any age to easily access all club information: check the latest results, view the standings of each category, read the latest news and updates, and access a private area for administrators. This admin panel enables easy and secure website content management. The design is intuitive and accessible, with a clear and functional structure. The project includes detailed technical documentation and the source code is available for review.
home.descriptionJava: Console application in Java with Maven that allows managing a shopping receipt. The user can add products, view the entire receipt, check the total price, and access each order line by its index. The project includes constructors, methods (getters, setters, equals, hashCode, toString), and array limit control to prevent adding more than 10 lines.
home.descriptionDawguardia: DawGuardia is a web application developed with CodeIgniter 4 that simulates a next-generation digital newspaper. The application features a public and private side with a complete role system: Administrator, Editor, Journalist, Subscriber, and Visitor, each with specific permissions. The project applies the MVC pattern with CodeIgniter and MySQL database management. The main features include:
home.functionDawguardia1: News management by journalists with prior validation from editors.
home.functionDawguardia2: Content classified into sections (local, sports, society, opinion, etc.).
home.functionDawguardia3: Comment system: Visitors can comment but require approval; subscribers can comment freely.
home.functionDawguardia5: Subscription management: registration, validation, and user deactivation due to non-payment.
home.functionDawguardia6: Full admin panel to manage users, roles, sections, and publications.
home.functionDawguardia7: News sharing via public links such as: https://localhost/news/section/the-news-headline.

aboutMe.title: About me
aboutMe.presentation1: Hi! I'm Genís Bou, a technician in Computer Systems Administration (ASIX) and a graduate in Web Application Development (DAW). I'm interested in both systems —managing equipment, networks, and infrastructure— and programming, including backend and frontend.
aboutMe.presentation2: I consider myself a consistent and responsible person with a quick learning ability. I enjoy working in a team and maintaining a proactive attitude, improving processes and finding new solutions.
aboutMe.presentation3: Currently, I continue expanding my knowledge in web development, learning modern frameworks and strengthening backend, frontend, and database concepts, aiming to grow in this web-oriented field.
